alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:07PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laramie County through 645 PM MDT... At 606 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Federal, or 18 miles west of Cheyenne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Cold air funnels may occur with this thunderstorm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crystal Lake Reservoir, Granite Springs Reservoir, Federal, Crystal Lake Campground, Warren AFB and Ranchettes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 356 and 358. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
